page.title: 04S.BADDESLEY/NORLEY WOOD
page.content: This scattered,rural parish now linked with Boldre includes the hamlets of Norley Wood,South Baddesley and Portmore.For many years there has been no shop or Post Office in the area and now the one bus service calls only at Norley Wood about once in 2 hours.A major proportion fo the area is in the ownership of 2 large estates,Newtown and Pylewell Parks.Residents are largely private property owners or agricultural tenants,there being no other industries (The Pylewell tenants can live in their estate cottages for as long as they need) The church of St.Mary,S.Baddesley was built around 185O by the then owner of Pylewell Park and the private entrance provided for them is still in use.The annual Christmas Fayre and the Summer Fete form the main fund-raising activites.
